evaluate.title: Spin up CDAP in the Cloud for Evaluation
evaluate.description: The CDAP Cloud Sandbox is a single-process package of CDAP optimized for the Cloud. Functionally identical with the CDAP Local Sandbox, it may differ in nomenclature, and may have additional optimizations - such as dedicated tabs in the Hub - specific to individual cloud providers. The CDAP Cloud Sandbox is available from the respective cloud providers' Marketplaces.

on_production.subTitle: on-production
on_production.title: Install CDAP in Mission-Critical Environments
on_production.description: If you are ready to install CDAP on your Hadoop cluster, in your Development, Testing, or Production environments, the following options are available to you: To add CDAP to your Cloudera Manager installations, using the CDAP Custom Service Descriptor (CSD) is the way to go. To use CDAP within your Hortonworks Data Platform (HDP) environment, use Apache Ambari (note that Apache Ambari can only be used to add CDAP to an existing Hadoop cluster). If you are using MapR, BigTop or the Apache distribution of Hadoop, we provide RPM and Debian distributions of CDAP to support your varied installation needs.

evaluate.subTitle: evaluate
evaluate.title: Run CDAP Locally for Evaluation
evaluate.description: CDAP is available as four single-process packages that can be installed and run locally, i.e. without the need to install on a cluster. These packages consist of the CDAP SDK, a local runtime, the CDAP UI, the CDAP CLI, tools and examples. Everything to get you started immediately on experimenting with data applications on your laptop or desktop. Once you are ready, your local copy can be easily moved to a distributed environment. These packages are not meant for production use and no patching is available for those images once deployed.
